reviews.text: We were comped at room at Harrah's . Had arranged for an early check in and confirmed the room type and early check in the day before. Upon arrival the room type and early check-in were not available...the front desk was totally inept. Advised us they would call us on our cell phones when the room was available and estimated a delay of about an hour...Three hours later when we called them the room was still not available...and also was not smoking as we had requested or a King bed...we eventually received the suite we had arranged...It was a very nice room...Mardi Gras Suite...nice color scheme with subtle useage of purple green and gold( mardi gras) colors in the decor. flat screen TV, dining room table, sitting area, nice useage of marble in the bathroom ,wet bar...it faced a courtyard that had a bit of noise from a jazz group but it wasn't excessive. An apology for our being inconvienced would have been nice but it was never offered. I'll definitely stay here again...but only if I don't have an pressing plans or engagements and can afford to not have access to lodging till the evening of day of arrival.
reviews.title: Suite Sweet?

likes.disliked: — The front desk was positively awful

reviews.text: This is one of the nicer Harrah's properties that I have stayed at. The rooms were beautiful, very well appointed. Being a diamond member of Harrah's Total rewards program, I was upgraded to s suite for free. The staff was excellent everwhere--front desk, housekeeping, valet, everyone!! The valet charges $25 to $35 per night to keep your car which i thought was high, but not uncommon for New Orleans. I love this casino. It so classy and upscale, yet so comfortable. The main bar in the middle of the casino is awesome. The only down side is that it's quite a hike to Bourbon Street. I will definetly stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: One of the nicer Harrahs

reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Harrah's hotel in New Orleans.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a great view of the bridge and city.
reviews.title: Reservations are a conceptual thing here....

likes.disliked: — The checking in/reservation process. The lies that the night manager told us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at this property is outstanding - the employees here are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: INCREDIBLE HOTEL !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful from the lobby to the bathrooms. Large deep soaking tub, separate shower - I loved that after a late night (early morning) return to the room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with a great location

reviews.text: The location is great as it is only a walk across the street to the casino, a block from the Mississippi and a few blocks to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel in an Awewsome City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 5th or 6th time and it just keeps getting better.
reviews.title: Luxury at its Best

reviews.text: Sometimes I am with my husband and other times with my girlfriend. No matter, you are still treated like royalty. My personal opinion is that they have the best rooms of any casino hotel either in New Orleans or on the Gulf Coast.
reviews.title: Harrah's Hotel New Olreans, La

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely Wonderful! I've stayed here a number of times.....each being better than the last. If your looking for Southern Hospitality, you'll get it here! As you enter and depart the hotel you'll be showered with "Good Morning, Good Afternoon, Have a Great Evening". The rooms are beautifully decorated, comfortable, and cozy. The only negative would be that this hotel does not have a pool.
reviews.title: New and great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the new Harrah's hotel across Poydrus from the casino. scored a 23rd floor corner suite. ((Diamond member)) It doesn't get any better than this. Had a window on two sides so we could see the river and business district. The bathroom was at least 10x12. Soaker tub, walk in shower. Had two big screen TV's.
reviews.title: Luxurious

reviews.text: Sitting room with a table, couch, bar etc.Had dinner at the French restaurant downatairs. Great food. there's an underground walkway to the casino in case it's raining. Had an overall great time, restaurants weren't crowded, Bourban Street was still hopping. Still see some buildings boarded up. Looks like N.O. is back in business.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed one night at Harrah's, booked through harrahs.com. Hotel was very impressive, not vanilla like Vegas' Harrah's property. It was like Rio or Paris LV properties, for comparison. They let us check in early, no problem. As other reviewers note, rooms are spacious with big foyer area, large bathroom with private toilet. Big jacuzzi tub and big shower. Nice Gilchrist & Soames toiletries like other high-end Harrah's properties. Hotel is very new so everything sleek, clean. Used fitness center, which had nice equipment and towels ready for you on the machines. Our room had a great view of the bend in the river looking toward the French Quarter. Great location, walked everywhere in French Quarter and close to CBD attractions also. Ate at the buffet's Sunday jazz champagne brunch, which I would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Great stay at Harrah's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and approachable. The room was lovely and spacious. The bed was so comfortable, pillows great, linens noticeably of quality, and the comforter just the right weight. The bathroom is huge, and I loved the strength of the shower!
reviews.title: Not Just for Gamblers.
There is segregation and really bad food at the buffet!
reviews.text: The hotel is located one block from Canal Street. It was a great location, especially if you like to venture out of French Quarter. We walked to Cafe du Monde every morning by taking the riverwalk, probably about 1/2 mile. So we got our share of the French Quarter experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also walked the other way to go to WWII museum, formerly DDay Museum. Another easy pleasant walk. We caught the St Charles trolley 3 blocks away and went and saw the Garden district.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.disliked: — $5 water, long hike to casino or parking

reviews.text: I recommend this hotel. Great location and great rooms. .
reviews.title: First rate
